metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Update Data In a MySQL Table Using MySQLi and PDO
The UPDATE statement is used to update existing records in a table:
content.html: The UPDATE statement is used to update existing records in a table:

content.code_html:
UPDATE table_name
SET column1=value, column2=value2,...
WHERE some_column=some_value

content.text: Notice the WHERE clause in the UPDATE syntax: The WHERE clause specifies which record or records that should be updated. If you omit the WHERE clause, all records will be updated!
content.html: Notice the WHERE clause in the UPDATE syntax: The WHERE clause specifies which record or records that should be updated. If you omit the WHERE clause, all records will be updated!

content.text: To learn more about SQL, please visit our SQL tutorial .
content.html: To learn more about SQL, please visit our SQL tutorial.

content.text: The following examples update the record with id=2 in the "MyGuests" table:
content.html: The following examples update the record with id=2 in the "MyGuests" table:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<?php$servername = "localhost";$username = "username";$password = "password";$dbname = "myDB";// Create connection$conn = new mysqli($servername, $username, $password, $dbname);
 // Check connection
 if ($conn->connect_error) {
  die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error);}

 $sql = "UPDATE MyGuests SET lastname='Doe' WHERE id=2";
 if ($conn->query($sql) === TRUE) {  echo "Record updated successfully";} else {  echo "Error updating record: " . $conn->error;}$conn->close();
?>

<?php
$servername = "localhost";
$username = "username";
$password = "password";
$dbname = "myDB";

// Create connection
$conn = new mysqli($servername, $username, $password, $dbname);
// Check connection
 if ($conn->connect_error) {
  die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error);
}

$sql = "UPDATE MyGuests SET lastname='Doe' WHERE id=2";

$conn->close();
?>

<?php$servername = "localhost";$username = "username";$password = "password";$dbname = "myDB";// Create connection$conn = new mysqli($servername, $username, $password, $dbname);
 // Check connection

 $sql = "UPDATE MyGuests SET lastname='Doe' WHERE id=2";

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<?php$servername = "localhost";$username = "username";$password = "password";$dbname = "myDB";// Create connection
$conn = mysqli_connect($servername, $username, $password, $dbname);
 // Check connection
 if (!$conn) {
    die("Connection failed: " . mysqli_connect_error());}$sql = "UPDATE MyGuests SET lastname='Doe' WHERE id=2";
 if (mysqli_query($conn, $sql)) {  echo "Record updated successfully";} else {
    echo "Error updating record: " . mysqli_error($conn);}mysqli_close($conn);
?>

syntaxHighlighting.text:
setAttribute(PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE, PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION);   $sql = "UPDATE MyGuests SET lastname='Doe' WHERE id=2";   // Prepare statement  $stmt = $conn->prepare($sql);  // execute the query   $stmt->execute();  // echo a message to say the UPDATE succeeded   echo $stmt->rowCount() . " records UPDATED successfully";} catch(PDOException $e) {  echo $sql . "
" . $e->getMessage();} $conn = null; ?>
// set the PDO error mode to exception
// echo a message to say the UPDATE succeeded

" records UPDATED successfully";} catch(PDOException $e) {  echo $sql . "
" . $e->getMessage();} $conn = null; ?>

syntax_highlighting.text:
setAttribute(PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE, PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION);   $sql = "UPDATE MyGuests SET lastname='Doe' WHERE id=2";   // Prepare statement  $stmt = $conn->prepare($sql);  // execute the query   $stmt->execute();  // echo a message to say the UPDATE succeeded   echo $stmt->rowCount() . " records UPDATED successfully";} catch(PDOException $e) {  echo $sql . "
" . $e->getMessage();} $conn = null; ?>
// set the PDO error mode to exception
// echo a message to say the UPDATE succeeded

content.code_html:
<?php
$servername = "localhost";
$username = "username";
$password = "password";
$dbname = "myDBPDO";

try {
  $conn = new PDO("mysql:host=$servername;dbname=$dbname", $username, $password);
  // set the PDO error mode to exception
  $conn->setAttribute(PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE, PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION);

  $sql = "UPDATE MyGuests SET lastname='Doe' WHERE id=2";

  // Prepare statement
  $stmt = $conn->prepare($sql);

  // execute the query
   $stmt->execute();

  // echo a message to say the UPDATE succeeded
   echo $stmt->rowCount() . " records UPDATED successfully";
} catch(PDOException $e) {
  echo $sql . "<br>" . $e->getMessage();
}

$conn = null;
?>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:

" records UPDATED successfully";} catch(PDOException $e) {  echo $sql . "
" . $e->getMessage();} $conn = null; ?>

// echo a message to say the UPDATE succeeded
